channel.title: Smart Ocean Cloud Platform
channel.description: Recent content on Smart Ocean Cloud Platform

item.title: Data model for time series data
item.description:
Interoperability is a central aspect of the SmartOcean platform which provided data provision and consumption via standardised REST and MQTT cloud APIs, and data and meta-data formats for service integration.

Work is ongoing on standardising a data- and meta-data format for the SmartOcean platform to be used both internally in the platform and for exposing data. The figure below shows the current basic data model being used by the SmartOcean platform.

item.title: Digital Twin for Optimising Acoustic Communication
item.description:
HVL and Bouvet has jointly developed a digital twin targetting the optimization of compression algorithm for acoustic underwater communication.

\

Dashboard for the digital twin solution: https://dashboard-smartocean1p.azurewebsites.net/ (requires login)

item.title: Smart Ocean Data Explorer
item.description:
Data sets from the Austevoll test site can be explored via the Smart Ocean Enlighten Data Explorer developed by NORCE.

SFI Smart Ocean Data Exploration: https://smartocean.web.norce.cloud/#/view/default

item.title: Norwegian Marine Data Centre
item.description:
A selected data set from the Austevoll test site has been made available via the Norwegian marine Data Centre.

Smart Ocean Austevoll Data Set: http://metadata.nmdc.no/metadata-api/landingpage/f4ef202da4c6dc873c7f67140a430ef9

item.title: About
item.description:
Smart Ocean Cloud Platform

The Smart Ocean digital ecosystem is a system-of-systems comprised of data consumer systems and applications, data provider systems and applications, external data services, end-user applications, and the Smart Ocean Data Service and Application Platform for development and deployment of smart ocean applications.

The platform is developed as part of the SFI Smart Ocean centre for research-based innovation funded by the Norwegian Research Council involving research and industry partners focussing on key challenges in developing smart ocean systems. The three main focus areas of the centre are: underwater sensor and measurement technology; underwater wireless sensor networks based on acoustic communication; and the Smart Ocean Platform for cloud-based data- and application services.

item.title: Contact
item.description:
Contact

The Smart Ocean cloud platform is developed and maintained by the software engineering research group at Western Norway University of Applied Sciences as part of Smart Ocean Work Package 3 on software technology and big-data middleware.

Work package leader: Prof. Lars Michael Kristensen

Several industry and research partners in the SFI Smart Ocean Consortium are involved in work package 3 and the development of the cloud platform

item.title: Publications
item.description:
Selected Papers

  • Keila Lima, Tosin Daniel Oyetoyan, Rogardt Heldal and Wilhelm Hasselbring, Evaluation of MQTT Bridge Architectures in a Cross-Organizational Context, 2025, IEEE 22nd International Conference on Software Architecture (ICSA) (2025): 243-254.

  • Ivan Spajić, Lars Michael Kristensen, Volker Stolz, Toward Digital-Twin-Assisted Data Acquisition in Underwater Acoustic Sensor Networks, Procedia Computer Science, Volume 257, 2025, Pages 241-248

  • Heldal, R., Is generalisation hindering the adoption of your findings? ESEM ’24: Proceedings of the 18th ACM/IEEE International Symposium on Empirical Software Engineering and Measurement, Pages 348 – 358
